episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: In its inaugural year Clive Lloyd led his West Indies team to victory culminating in one of the most famous and historic finals against Australia in World Cup history.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: Clive Lloyd in 1979 led one of histories most complete and accomplished one day sides that went on to convincingly dismantle all those laid before them

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Kapil Dev reigned victorious in 1983 as he and his India team beat some of the world's cricketing power houses of the time to become only the second country to lift the World Cup trophy.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Allan Border led Australia to their first World Cup victory against England in what turned out to be one of the tournaments most closely fought finals.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: The 1992 tournament would see a number of firsts for the tournament, being held for the first time in the Southern Hemisphere the outcome would also be a first with Pakistan under the leadership of Imran Khan capturing their first World Cup trophy.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot: Arujuna Ranatunga led Sri Lanka to their first World Cup victory with their infamous four pronged spin attack and inspirational Sanath Jayaswiya, on route they would beat the likes of England, India and Australia.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: Steve Waugh's led his talented side that included players such as a young Ricky Ponting and Shane Warne to One Day victory and would start a cycle World Cup of dominance by Australia.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Ricky Ponting would lead his Australia from the front in 2003 with a stunning 140 runs off 121 balls performance in the final to help ensure Australia would win their 3rd World Cup title.

episode of.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: 2007 saw Australia's World Cup winning streak extend to 29 consecutive games in turn retaining the trophy, the tournament as a whole would be dominated by the Australians with Glenn McGrath picking up Man of the Series and 29 wickets and Matthew Hayden achieving highest runs scorer with 659.

imdb.plot outline: This stand alone mini-series relives the events of each of the ICC Cricket World Cup and each of it's previous winners. Blow-by-blow the series documents the highs and lows of each the tournament, its champions and the captains who led them there.
imdb.title: ICC: I Captured the Cup
plot: This stand alone mini-series relives the events of each of the ICC Cricket World Cup and each of it's previous winners. Blow-by-blow the series documents the highs and lows of each the tournament, its champions and the captains who led them there.
